answers.answer: Oh yeah she said that she was recently tested  back in march 2011 and all test including igg were negative, before then she wasn't sexual active for about 8 months...

it's always low risk from a one time unprotected encounter though certainly not no risk.the best thing to do would be for her to ask this fellow to show her his last std test results so she can have a little more peace of mind.if she wants to cover her bases because she doesn't trust this fellow, she can get tested for chlamydia and gonorrhea after 1 week post encounter. syphilis after 6 weeks. herpes and hiv after 3 months.  should she develop any obvious genital symptoms before then, she should be seen promptly.grace
Thank You Grace I will pass the information along...

Hello im back again with an important question for my friend/roommate..dis morning she said she was experincing some tingling and itching in her right foot..she has been crying all morning because she's scared its herpes, I've been trying to calm her down but its not working..what should she do its only been 2weeks since her last unprotected sex incounter ? :(

Ok so here's an update my friend said she has tingling in both feet, hands and certain parts of her leg..now diabetes run in her family could that be the problem because she has gained a lot of weight within the past year or is it herpes ? No other symptoms besides the tingling and its mainly in her feet...
odds are this isn't related to a std or diabetes. stress will do a lot of things to you. if the tingling continues, she should see her provider for a proper exam.

question: Hello again, I have a friend who recently told me she had unprotected sex wit a guy that she has been seeing on and off for about 5yrs..she's in a panic that she is at risk for herpes smh the guy claims that he's clean but yet she says she doesn't know..what are the chances she contracted an std ? Its only been a week since the incounter..I'm really nervous for her because she's freakin out :(
title: Chances of getting herpes....
